meanings.definition: A point where two systems, subjects, organizations, etc., meet and interact.
meanings.sent1: The interface between the two departments allows for smooth communication.
meanings.sent2: The interface of the computer software facilitates user interaction.
meanings.sent3: At the interface of the two teams, collaboration blooms.
meanings.sent4: The interface between art and science is where creativity thrives.
meanings.sent5: The interface acts as a bridge connecting different parts of the organization.

meanings.definition: A device or program enabling communication between two pieces of equipment or systems.
meanings.sent1: The technician fixed the interface connecting the printer and the computer.
meanings.sent2: The USB interface allows data transfer between devices.
meanings.sent3: The interface seemed to have a mind of its own, making the devices chat endlessly.
meanings.sent4: The interface is like a translator, ensuring smooth communication between machines.
meanings.sent5: The interface is the key to unlocking seamless connectivity between systems.

meanings.definition: To interact with a system or device.
meanings.sent1: Users can interface with the software through a user-friendly interface.
meanings.sent2: I need to interface with the new device to set it up properly.
meanings.sent3: I tried to interface with the vending machine, but it didn't understand my request.
meanings.sent4: She learned how to interface with the complex system after some training.
meanings.sent5: It is important to interface carefully to avoid any technical issues.
